I'm curious as to the 'PID' algorithms in locking onto nodes..

Considering that a space program would be fairly advanced in all scientific fields... 

I find all the node locking algorithms abysmal, except for the maneuver node - so who programmed this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If I'm not mistaken.. KSP Windows is running under 'managed code' - please don't do this !!

MSoft Managed coding is a disaster... steer well clear of this for games and simulations.

Progressing to 64 bit will not resolve the current issues while under managed code

Sort out the 32 bit code first.. nudge nudge

![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Yes, the node hold is bad: in fact, I'm not sure it even uses PID at all. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

But they can probably fix it. 

Or you can learn to fly the darn thing yourself... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I didn't learn to fly with attitude hold, I learned to fly by the stars!

(Seriously, though, I'm not kidding. I did not understand the navball at all, and would spend a minute and a half just figuring out which way to burn to go in the right direction. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Those were the days.)
